intro: Dombeya nyasica, commonly known as the Malawi dombeya, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Dombeya nyasica is often found in forest margins and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
